articles.title: 'Breaking Bad' In Mumbai? Chemistry Grad Arrested In 1,400 Crores Drug Haul
articles.description: Mumbai police seized more than 700 kg of mephedrone worth Rs 1,400 crore following a raid at a drug manufacturing unit in Nalasopara of Palghar district, and arrested five persons, including a post-graduate in organic chemistry, an official said.
articles.content:
Mumbai: Anti-Narcotics Cell of Mumbai crime branch conducted the raid at the unit.

articles.title: Murders of Ripudaman Singh Malik, Sidhu Moose Wala put spotlight back on Punjabi gangs in Canada
articles.description: The police in Canada have issued a public warning identifying 11 men, of whom nine are of Punjab origin, linked to extreme levels of gang violence. | World News

articles.title: Mallikarjun Kharge, Piyush Goyal spar in Rajya Sabha over ED summons to Congress leaders
articles.description: Mallikarjun Kharge said he was summoned by the ED at a time when Parliament is in session; Piyush Goyal responded by saying Congress leaders should face the law and claimed that the government does not interfere in the functioning of law-enforcement agencies.
articles.content:
Pointing out that he has been summoned by the ED at a time when Parliament is in session, Kharge asked if it was fair on the part of the agency to do so.

articles.title: CJI NV Ramana recommends Justice UU Lalit as his successor
articles.description: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Thursday recommended to the government the name of Justice Uday Umesh Lalit as his successor.
articles.content:
Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana, whose tenure ends on August 26, recommended Justice Uday Umesh Lalit as his successor on Thursday.

articles.title: Angry China Fires Missiles Around Taiwan In Largest-Ever Military Drills
articles.description: China fired ballistic missiles and deployed fighter jets and warships on Thursday as it held its largest-ever military exercises around Taiwan, a show of force sparked by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island.
articles.content:
Nancy Pelosi left Taiwan yesterday after a trip that defied a series of stark threats from China.
